case.state: heya. if you're reading this, that means you're going through the game files. cool. these lines aren't really supposed to play yet.
i'm only gonna ask this once. are you sure you wanna do this?
heya. i'm sans. sans the skeleton.
that's s-a-n-s.
you having second thoughts there, bud?
c'mon, my puns aren't that bad.
you know, i didn't always like bad jokes either. but they've groan on me.
nah, if you didn't like them, you'd have stopped by now.
alright, i know your type. so since you're gonna keep doing this, let me tell you a story.
so i'm a sentry in snowdin forest, right?
i sit out there and watch for humans. it's kind of boring.
fortunately, i'm not the only guy on the job.
there's this one guard who never leaves his post.
so of course, i stop by every day to tell him a joke. he loves it.
and every time, he'll tell me a really cheesy one in return.
he has this one, awful knee-slapper that seems to be a permanent fixture in his "dad joke" repertoire.
he's told me this one at least six times, so i'm pretty sure this joke is constantly on standby for him.
this is the exact conversation each time.
he'll start with: "how are you doing this fine evening?"
and i'll respond, purposefully setting myself up for it: "pretty good, how about you?"
and then he'll go "really? well i've never been *pretty* or *good*, so i don't know what that's like!"
and then he'll keep laughing like it's the funniest joke that's ever been told. it's great.
what i'm trying to say is, some people have way too much fun doing the same thing over and over again.
eh, guess i can't stop you.
cool name.
welp, don't say i didn't warn ya.
hey there, kiddo. it's been a while.
oh, hey, mettaton. gee, the doc sure did a number on your body, huh?
heya. thanks for inviting me.
